parameters.description:
storm basin for which to get data. 
        if source is 'atcf', one of: 'AL', 'CP', 'EP', 'SL'. 
        if source is 'simulated', one of: 'EP', 'NA', 'NI', 'SI', 'SP' 'WP'. 
        if source is 'historical', one of: 'NI', 'SI', 'NA', 'EP', 'WP', 'SP', 'SA'.

404.description: invalid source, basin or geographic args

200.description: time series csv with points along tropical storm routes

get.summary: get data on the tracks of tropical storms
get.description:
Note: for this endpoint (radius, lat, lon) and (min_lat, min_lon, max_lat, max_lon) are incompatible parameters.
i.e., if given parameters containing members from both tuples, return 404
in addition, the function's args must contain either all members of one of the above tuples, or none
i.e., if given parameters containing some but not all of the members of one of the above tuples, return 404

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: if given radius, lat, lon, will subset csv to only include points within radius in km of the point (lat, lon)

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: if given radius, lat, lon, will subset csv to only include points within radius in km of the point (lat, lon)

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: if given radius, lat, lon, will subset csv to only include points within radius in km of the point (lat, lon)

parameters.name: min_lat
parameters.description: if given min_lat, min_lon, max_lat, max_lon, selects points within a bounding box.

parameters.name: min_lon

info.title: dClimate API
info.description:
Get decentralized weather data from dClimate IPFS Database. Using dWeather-Python-Client version: 2.1.3

---   #### Getting started: #### [API Registration Walkthrough](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ixbhdFToEPI) #### [dClimate API Walkthough](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qrtGGbvLj40)   #### Learn more about dClimate: #### [dClimate Home Page](https://www.dclimate.net/) #### [dClimate Github](https://github.com/dClimate)  

API Documentation:

---

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask
